decisions.name: DidUnitsMatch
decisions.label: Check Original Goal and Units Match

formulas.name: formOfTypeType
formulas.expression: IF({!Type}=""," type is blank"," type is "+{!Type})

Flow.interviewLabel: Set Goal for Steps in Object Field {!$Flow.CurrentDateTime}
Flow.label: Flowdometer - Set Goal for Steps in Object Field

fields.name: CreatedConf
fields.fieldText:
Your goal is now set!


Click to view this goal

fields.name: Description
fields.fieldText:
Set a Goal

There is no Goal attached to this Flow. Set targets for time spent, and going forward, this Goal will be automatically attached to matching Flows. Choose an object and a field. Use the name as it shows on the Page Layout.

Example:

Object to track: Opportunity

Field to track: Stage

fields.name: Type
fields.helpText:
OPTIONAL - Type should be blank unless you plan on having different goal times for different Types of this object (ie: New Business vs Renewal Opportunities may expect different sales cycle times). 


If so, put the API Name of the field you’re using to identify these types here in the Type field. If you need to combine two or more fields to get all Type permutations, you can build a formula field to concatenate them, and pass that in here.

fields.name: Apply_this_goal_against_historical_data_without_a_goal
fields.fieldText: Apply this goal retroactively (see help text)
fields.helpText:
Checking this will have Flowdometer apply this goal against any previously tracked Flowdometer data that has no goal and matches this goal. It will not overwrite goals you already have set against old data, even if they match. This could be done manually or by deleting the other goal first.


A match is found if the tracking data is for this same Object and Field. If Type is provided, it will also only match tracking data with the same Type.

fields.name: StepNameDescription
fields.fieldText:
Name of initial Step

Default or beginning value of {!Field_to_track} on {!Other_Object_Name}

Examples:

1st Stage on the Opportunity: Prospecting

1st Status on Case: New

fields.name: First_Step_Name
fields.helpText: The text/label value of the first step or stage of your process. For example, maybe Opportunities start in New

fields.name: StepGoalHandleTime
fields.fieldText: Set a target "Time to First Response": (how long it takes to finish this initial step)

fields.name: Units
fields.helpText: This is where you choose if you want to set goals in Hours, Days, or (see red warning) Weekdays

fields.name: First_Goal_Handle_Time
fields.helpText: The amount of time this first step should take, in the units you selected previously. All remaining steps will use the same units.

fields.name: WeekdayWarningNote
fields.fieldText: NOTE: setting a goal in Weekdays is imprecise, and counts in whole days (vs decimals)

fields.name: StepNameDescription_0
fields.fieldText:
Next Step after {!varCurrentStepName}:

(for {!Field_to_track} on the object {!Other_Object_Name})

fields.name: Step_Name_0
fields.helpText: Continue through this process, step by step, until you reach your final step, which we call the Terminal Step.

fields.name: warning
fields.fieldText:
IMPORTANT: Toggle "Keep Going?" to off when you enter the final step in your process.


Your final step should mean the process succeeded (like Closed Won or Completed). You can add additional terminal steps (like Closed Lost) from the "Add Terminal Step" button on the newly created goal when you finish it.


There is also a button on every Goal record to Clone it, making changes to Step Names and Goal Times as you go, if you have a similar goal for example. You can find a goal attached to Tracker Flows and Steps.

fields.name: StepNameDescription_0_0
fields.fieldText: How many {!Units} should "{!Step_Name_0}" take?

fields.name: Goal_Handle_Time_0_0
fields.helpText: The time (in {!Units}) you want this step to take

fields.name: typically_takes
fields.fieldText: Based on historical data, i﻿t typically takes {!formTypicallyTakes} {!Units}
